column3: A major appeal of Open Science is the capacity to harness collective intelligence and face big scientific challenges, unmet when researchers are working in isolation. Below is a list of such projects. Work your way through the list (up to you if you wish to divide and conquer, work in couples or as a group) to discover the projects. Apply your score (1-5 low-to-high score), using 10 of the Vienna Open Science Principles (Do read here: https://viennaprinciples.org/ to rank the projects’ ‘openness’. Add a few comments on what you appreciated and what you think could be improved in these projects.
Premise of the project in one simple phrase!
Cutting-edge research infrastructure to help advance neurosience, medicine and computing.
column15: Co founded by the EU (so very solid project), very good organization
column16: Transparency, data availability, explanation how data quality is assessed

column3: By linking together existing telescopes using novel systems, the EHT enables to observe black holes.
column16: Maybe finding a way of including non-scientists in the project?

column3: Pedagogical Platform assesing the credibility of scientific publications online.
column15: Very helpful for researchers and students who want to learn on credible data collection and analysis
column16: User-intefrface is difficult to navigate through, especially if wanting to go to the main page. Moreover, graphs could be explanined in the case of student or junior researchers unfamiliar with statistics

column3: Open source project that aims to build the first virtual organism by gathering a wide range of literature, data and platforms.
column15: Very open to collaborate with any kind of public and to recive feedback. Wide range of different resources, from code to literature or platforms
column16: In the section dedicated to publications, it would be good to include more than the latest ones.

column3: Creation of an accessible and granular environment data
column15: collaboration very important, data easily available
column16: Organization of the website sometimes unclear

column3: This kit, created for digital education, is made of an easily programmable mini-computer
column15: Really interesting pedagogical project to learn about digital sciences
column16: The interface of the project is not completely finished. All the sections could be translated in english

column15: Open education, free, Help for immigration people to be well educated.
column16: Connect with more online platform and create students projects platform.
